Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: TrailsurferUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Rome Marathon weekend and thought this place was a bargain for the price. Room was nicely kept and had a balcony. The guy at the front desk was not that friendly, but then I hardly had reason to interact with him as I worked out roughly what I'd be doing before I left. I can never work out why people harp on about the staff. It's in Rome so who wants to spend their time cooked up in a hotel moaning about staff? The breakfast was one of the best continental ones I've come accross. The waitress was also very friendly and was chatting to many of us runners. I never noticed any bad smells except perhaps us sweaty runners after the race :-)

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Below Average Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kaypo23
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just okay. It was clean and basic, nothing special. The location was just okay as well. The staff was not the friendliest and were either not knowledgeable about the area or they just didn't care. We were given some bad references for restaurants within walking distance and some bad advice for a "hop-on-hop-off" tour. I didn't take advantage of the breakfast, so I can't comment on that, but I did use the internet, which was slow and kept kicking me off.

Reviews.Title: “Smells Horrible, Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Harrison B
Reviews.Content: The smell coming out of the drain in the bidet was horrible! The only way to sleep through it was to put a glass over it and leave the door shut. Everyday we would leave our room with the glass over the drain and the bathroom door shut and everyday we would come back and the cleaning lady had removed the glass, opened the bathroom door, turned off the A/C, and opened the window. So once again the smell of hot sewage permeated our room, bed, and clothes. There was constant "renovation" ongoing throughout our 4-night stay. Actually the were patching up walls where they looked to have fallen, or even worse collapsed. The front desk did not care if you were staying there or not, they were not friendly or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but poor service”
Reviews.Author: lisa l
Reviews.Content: this hotel was tidy and clean but unfortunatly because of the staff at the front desk, our stay was made uncomfortable. because we are backpaking europe and turned up at the hotel with our backpacks it seem like we were "lower class" compared to other guests. breakfast was nice and the waitress was lovely, quiet location. dont think we would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Okay little hotel”
Reviews.Author: keukamoon
Reviews.Content: Nice enough traditional and old fashioned Italian room. There was a faint smell of cigarette smoke in our room and throughout the hotel. If I had been planning to stay longer than 2 nights, I would have had to leave due to the odor. Also, some equipment outside in the courtyard hummed continuously throughout our 2 day stay. All of that aside, good location, nice staff and EXCELLENT breakfast......

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttish_Wanderers
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms, one for my parents and one for myself and my wife. The rooms we were allocated were next to each other but not in the main hotel. Our room was very small, you could barely walk around the end of the bed and there was no space for our suitcases. The other room was larger, but the air conditioning didn't work properly. It turned on but then switched itself off after a few minutes and needed to be switched on again. This is fine when you're awake but it got very hot during the night. When we mentioned this to the reception staff their response was "It switches on, then it works!". It took them four days to change the room after no one came to look at the air conditioning unit during this time. The room was immediately given to someone else after my parents had moved out of it. The room my parents were allocated was a similar size and standard. In this room the drains were very smelly and the refrigerator didn't work. As they required to keep medication chilled this was particularly inconvenient. We complained again and they were moved to "the best room in the hotel". This room was in the main hotel and was still basic but it was an improvement on the previous rooms. For the price we paid the standard in the main hotel was fine but if you are allocated rooms in the other building they are substandard! The rooms in the building outside the main hotel are also very noisy, the doors are paper thin and the main power tripped a few times during our stay so no one had any air conditioning or lights! Another point to note is there are no tea or making facilities in the rooms or available anywhere else in the hotel. They advertise having a bar but it was closed for our entire stay (8nights). The location is good and there are some nice restaurants a short walk away from the hotel. It is also quite close to a metro station and not too far a walk from the colosseum. There is a continental breakfast which is good and the waitress that worked most days was very efficient and friendly (a breath of fresh air compared to the other staff)!

Reviews.Title: “You only get what you pay for !!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottishJock
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very basic,I was a single traveller and was conserned with some of the other reviews before I went,if I had to stay here again I would make sure it was not a single room,the hotel does not have a bar for a drink at night and does not serve food other that continental breakfast,it is quite close to the underground and close to some eating places,it is also only a 15 minute walk from the colesseum,staff were helpfull. Private bus from the Airport only costs around 4 to 6 Euros and takes you straight into Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cristian10Bucharest
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone. We've stayed at Hotel Bled in november 2010. It is pretty close to the Colliseum (like a walk of 15 minutes), the rooms were neat and beautiful, the breakfast was very good and all was fresh, our room was cleaned every day. we had no incidents, all was great. I recommand it. there were no smells like some say in here, furniture was in good condition, also tv and mini fridge, there was hot water all the time. what else can I say. It was worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: tut1
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews but we had a lovely stay in Rome, the hotel was very clean and tidy, our room couldn't be faulted. Breakfast was a cold buffet - what you normally get in Europe - but was always plentiful and very fresh. I'd recommend the Hotel Bled for the above and its walking distance to the Coloseum and also near tram and metro stops to go anywhere else. One word of warning though, on check out we got a bill for tourist tax, 4 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Bled”
Reviews.Author: Sadielady1
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews, I felt the need to include one that was positive. We loved everything about Hotel Bled. The service was outstanding (and we went to Rome during "high season"). When we arrived at the original hotel we booked we were told they were full and had misplaced our papers for reservation. Luckily, we have dear friends who live in Rome and Hotel Bled was recommended. Our room (actually two rooms w/bathroom) was clean, the beds were comfortable and we were next to the garden. Location is everything in Rome and we could walk to the Colloseum (Coliseum) if we wanted to. There were wonderful deli's and cafes across the street. When we asked for extra towels/pillows, they were there on the spot. Great experience for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: JKDC
Reviews.Content: Put simply, there is no reason to stay in this hotel (except maybe the price -- but you can find other similarly priced hotels that are better). I entered my room and it smelled musty; after two days of leaving the window open it improved, but the bathroom still smelled like mildew. The bed was extremely uncomfortable -- to the point where I had to leave the hotel (see below). Staff were friendly enough, but not particularly helpful. Breakfast was acceptable but nothing special. And the location, while not terrible, is nothing great either. (The hotel is a 15-20 minutes walk from the Colloseum, and a 5 minute walk from a Metro stop.) I stayed in this hotel because someone else was paying for the room. The room was so bad that I left after two nights and paid my own way somewhere else. That shows you how bad it was. Note: The hotel has rooms in multiple buildings. This might explain some of the disparity in the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, Hotel is below standard”
Reviews.Author: donna54946
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel when our nicer hotel was booked. We stayed in two rooms with 2 people each. One room had a broken door, dirty, smelly bathroom and the bed was full of ants. The bathroom also had ants. When I complained they let me know that there were no more rooms to move to. They allowed me to stay next door in the Daniellea hotel. My daughter had to share a room with other family in the Bled Hotel. Their room also was smelly and the bathroom was dirty. The air conditioning would not work. The front staff was appoligetic and did their best but overall this hotel is dumpy. I will not reccomend to anyone to stay here. I would rather sleep in the train station than here, the bathrooms are cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: PamNewcastleuponTyne
Reviews.Content: Aftrer booking I read reviews and was a little worried. I was right to worry - myslef and 3 friends (4 females) arrived aftert 10 o'clock at night and after pulling our cases up two flights of stairs to get into the hotel were greeted by a man asking if I had spoken to him today? Alarm bells started ringing - he told us the hotel was fully booked! He said they were sending us to their sister hotel Grand Hermitage and would taxi us over there. The hotel was the far side of Rome and we would never have booked this as it was far too far out for walking around the city. We had to use taxis and buses which added to the price of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews are unfair and misleading”
Reviews.Author: LoversofRome
Reviews.Content: We almost cancelled our booking having read the previous reviews; luckily common sense prevailed and we kept to our original plans. We certainly did not find the hotel or the area anything like as bad as the previous travellers reported. First of all the area of Santa Croce is fine. We saw one homeless person sleeping in a doorway in the area. (Try going to London if you want to see some real in-your-face hardship and homelessness in the city ). There were no marauders or drug-addicts or hooligans anywhere in the area., which the previous reveiws seem to suggest. We walked at night very safely back and forth from the Manzoni Metro (which again is perfectly safe. At times it gets crowded, but as a tourist you can easily avoid the rush-hour). There are half a dozen different types of eating places within sight of the hotel, a pizzeria, a trattoria, a ristorante (glamourous and expensive) a fast-food pizza place and a Japanese restaurant. How much choice did these people want? The pizzeria was a very friendly family-run place which had an extensive menu and not just pizzas of course. If you really can not manage a single word of Italian, there is a buffet for the antipasti (starters) and if you need to you can just point to what you want to eat. A slightly further walk takes you to a fabulous 'osteria' which also had an extensive menu and lovely, country-style food. There are 'green' areas around, just outside the hotel is part of the historic wall of old Rome and if you follow that along you will come to a convenient bus terminus at Porta Maggiore. The gateway is also historic and interesting. You just have to take the blinkers off and appreciate what you are seeing. At the end of the road is the church of Santa Croce and a little further on the beautiful church of San Giovanne in Laterano; even for the non-religious these are amazing buildings to visit. The room we had was average to good as compared with similar rooms in European hotels. The bathroom was small, but contained all facilities, and an excellent shower. Towels (three each) were changed every day. The room was cosy and there may be an issue with air-conditioning in the summer (we certainly didn't need it as the weather in May was unseasonably cold). There was a secure room available with safety deposit boxes and our luggage was stored here when we checked out, until the transfer taxi arrived. The breakfast which has received so many complaints in other reviews was absolutely fine. Again, easily comparable with European breakfasts. Cereal, fresh fruit, fruit salad, bread rolls, cheeses, cold meats, tomatoes, boiled eggs, pastries, croissants fruit juices, coffees etc etc. If you expect and want a fried English breakfast, then stay in the UK. The staff at reception were business-like and helped when they could. Most speak English, one gentleman spoke very good English and was helpful in respect of aranging the safe, and checking we were OK for the transfer etc. Try some politeness and a few friendly words of Italian. Buongiorno, or Buona sera and a smile will work wonders. Overall this was a three-star hotel with three-star standards in a convenient and quiet location. Be prepared to use the metro, the bus or walk and you will get to experience the excitement of this bustling and interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bad.”
Reviews.Author: Commentator_999
Reviews.Content: The hotel's main asset is its location, close to Manzonni Metro. The neighborhood was safe enough during the day (despite appearances), and there were a few restaurants and other amenities in walking distance. The hotel itself was unacceptable. Cramped, muggy rooms with small, uncomfortable cots, toilets that didn't flush properly, no working telephones for our entire stay, intermittent lighting, and a staff that, although not entirely unfriendly, was disinclined to make the smallest effort. On the whole, it was quite uncomfortable, and had this been a romantic getaway, it would have ruined our trip. Do yourself a favor and spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “They literally robbed us.”
Reviews.Author: rahhh
Reviews.Content: I'm going to get straight into this. All my brother's clothes were stolen at the Hotel Bled. When we complained to the reception, the extremely rude woman called the cleaning lady and asked whether she had stolen clothes (as if she was going to admit she had). That was about as far as her investigation went. Then she told us that if we didn't like it, we should all just leave. She then went home in a huff. No apology - no nothing. Later that evening, we learned that another man's laptop had been stolen as well as his jewellry. So not only was the food rubbish - the hotel is full of thieves. Go there at your own peril.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back there”
Reviews.Author: Paula020
Reviews.Content: Very good plus of this hotel is it's location - aprox. 20 minutes walk from Coloseum but generally that's it. We had bed & breakfast option. Breakfast buffet was very poor, simple selection of breads, some yoghurts, 2-3 platters with meat and cheese, croissants (you had to go very early to get any), jams and juices. Tea and coffee was served by staff who couldn't speak english. But not the breakfast was the worst. Air-con was our nightmare. It was working till 4-5am, very noisy and it was freezing inside the room. It was much wormer outside than inside the room. We've spoken to reception a few times about it and we were assured air-con is off at midnight but it wasn't a true, and all you had to cover yourself was a single sheet. We couldn't open the window as there was one of main streets so it was noisy. Also cleaning was an issue as it was look like they were using chemicals to clean bathroom appliances but no one bother to rinse it as I had a painful rush after 3-4 days of living there.

Reviews.Title: “My handbad was stolen at the reception one minute after arrival, be careful, dont take that hotel!”
Reviews.Author: korzika
Reviews.Content: My bag has benn stolen one minute after I stepped in the hotel with all my personal needs in it!Take care who ever you are, whatever you have in your handbag! The men behind the reception desk did not care about anything, not even me and my problem. He did not even came out to check what could happen. Did it ever happen before?? Is it going to happen in the future? For sure!! The staff is not friendly at all. It Rooms are smelling after..... Breakfast is very poor. I am not returning, that is for sure and not going to recommend it for anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love hotel Bled”
Reviews.Author: carparkdorset
Reviews.Content: The room was OK - more like 2* though. We stayed here as there was somewhere to put our car. You'd better be early for breakfast (boiled eggs, ham, cheese, awful rolls) because when things on the buffet run out they are not replenished. There was absolutely no way of getting a cup of tea or anything in the hotel after breakfast - no room service and nothing in the rooms. Receptionist had the shrug the shoulders take it or leave it attitude. It was NOT a nice walk from the hotel to the centre. I would not have left this hotel on our itinery had I read reviews from tripadviser first.

Reviews.Title: “Bled us dry”
Reviews.Author: GingernutLongford
Reviews.Content: On arrival into hotel at 22.30, we were told that no paperwork existed for our stay. After quite a protracted argument with the extremely rude male receptionist, we felt because of the lateness of the hour, we had no choice but to pay for a room for one night. We weren't sure of the area or where to look for other accommodation so we booked the room. The following morning, a minor miracle occurred (after all, we were in the Eternal City) and our booking was found. However, we weren't reimbursed for nine months for having double paid for the first night. Again we had to constantly keep ringing Rome from Ireland for nine months before we finally got our money back. The hotel was filthy, staff were extremely rude and the room we got on the first night might as well have been on spaghetti junction with the traffic noise all night. We asked to be moved to another room which we were. When we arrived back from our sight seeing we discovered that the sheets hadn't been changed nor the room cleaned. When we asked to have the sheets changed we were told that there were no staff available to do this and we would have to wait till morning. We demanded fresh sheets and made the beds ourselves. The room itself was no bigger than a broom cupboard. You could barely stand at the end of the bed before hitting the partition wall of the bathroom. Breakfast was like russian roulette. Unfortunately, we both came down with severe food poisoning. My partner was about to drink his orange juice when I noticed lip stick marks on the glass. I slapped the glass from his hands. All the cutlery and crockery was filthy. We observed the girl splashing water on the used crockery/cutlery in a basin and placing them back on the buffet table. There were flies all over the food. Nothing was cleaned properly and used food was placed back on the buffet table the next day. The hotel was too far from the centre of Rome and like a previous reviewer said, it didn't feel safe walking from the metro station at night (which close at 8.30 by the way). Manzoni station was still closed when we were there. Overall our experience was the experience from hell. I couldn't get over how rude, unfriendly and downright arrogant the staff at the front desk were. We asked for help with regard to restaurants, getting about and the stock answere was "you must go to the centre". If you want to gamble with your health, go for this hotel, otherwise steer well clear.

Reviews.Title: “Could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: babe-storm
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to add some comments. Others commented on the location because the metro was closed, we had no problems with the Manzoni station, nice short walk from hotel, but definately open. The main problem with the location is that the hotel is towards the outskirts and whilst not in a "rough" area, its not a pleasant walk back from the metro at night, there are a fair few vagrants sleeping rough in doorways and street lighting is poor. However taxi cost from center is not too bad cost us less than 10 euros from Via del Corso. Breakfast was fab, but if your not a pastry eater avoid. To say the hotel is on a busy road, the glazing was great and we didn't hear much traffic. Only issue we had was cleaniness, shower walls were a bit moldy, other aspects of bathroom not cleaned as much as I'd have liked. And sheets weren't great. Other aspects of the hotel were clearly being repaired, but this is only an appearence issue and doesn't detract from the purpose of a bed to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djdave68
Reviews.Content: I only found out about Trip Advisor after booking the hotel bled. Otherwise I would of changed the booking after reading the reviews. Please see below what I found. Hotel Staff I Staff found the staff very friendly and helpful. Location I read in another review about the nearest underground being shut last year. It was still shut in Aug 07. This means a 10-15 min walk to the nearest underground station. The hotel is not ideally located for the main sights of Rome and needs this access to the underground (best to check if it has reopened before booking) Bad points Security looks to be an issue. With the rooms being easily opened with any blunt object. Some doors show signs of forced entry. Breakfast. Fruit juice tasted like it has been watered down. Generaly a below average breakfast. Cledlness Not the best, with traces of the previous occupiers left on the floor.(Cotton Buds and Hair grip) Good Points Roof balconies are a nice place to relax on. Overall You get what you pay for. I booked a cheap long weekend break and the hotel lived up to these expiations. With a little care and attention and new furniture in the reception then this hotel would be worthy of it’s star rating

Reviews.Title: “Get me out of here !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: opi20000
Reviews.Content: Unfortunaly I could not stay in this hotel due to many reasons. After being in Rome when it was 38 (95 degrees) outside and inside my small room it was a few degrees less, I anticipated the air conditioner to function however it was broken for 5 days. So I had to sweet outside and inside the room. I was told many conflicting reasons by the GM Ms Greco, why it was not on or not working, until I told the hotel receptionist I was leaving earlier than expected, and then explained to me that the motor was broken. They told me the AC is a central air unit and not seperate by room. Unfortunatley Ms Greco the GM, did not tell me the truth that the AC was down, I was told that they shut it down often for many reasons, she was also rude to the other English speaking people who were complaining to her about it. She told me that her staff did not know what they were doing and she had to find new staff. The hotel was also low of staff, when I spoke with them they were not motivated to work for this hotel company. My room had hair in the bathroom when I arrived to the room. There was fruit fly’s near the juice in the restaurant and one inside the orange juice jug, I looked for other rooms in Roma but many hotels were booked. I was disappointed in the hotel for its heigine, the GMs professionalism and no AC.

Reviews.Title: “Not one for us”
Reviews.Author: swiba1
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel in September 2006 we were concerned when we arrived to ber told that there was no paperwork valid for our stay. We were then offered a room which in the words of the gentleman on reception, was not the biggest or nicest room, but that it was all he could offer. Well it certainly wasn't big, and although it had everything we wanted, oh except for plugs in the washbasin and the bidet, broken shower door and room to move in the bathroom, we accepted it. It was a the front of the hotel right on a busy ( NOISEY ) cross-roads, so the windows were closed all night. Minimum temperature 20 -23C. The location within the city was ok if you like walking, 20mins from Colloseo from which you were close to all other sites to see. The web site says there are many good restaurants within 50 metres. Don't believe it, for a good one you must walk at least 10 mins. Would recommend Romantica on via Emmanuele Filiberto for a good meal, not cheap but good, with free entertainment. But I can’t recommend this hotel purely for the offhand way we were treated on arrival. It did not however spoil what was an excellent long weekend in the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 3 star hotel but ok for 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: Wicki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bled in mid-march for 2 nights, beeing sent there by our actually but overbooked hotel "Porta Maggiore". The hotel is said to be a 3-star-one but I think 2 stars would be more correct. The rooms we had were very small, but clean, with relativly new bathroom furnitures and a really good matraze in the double-bed. We decided to stay there instead of our actually booked hotel after having seen the rooms because we just had a 2-nights-trip and would not want to argue about where to stay with such limited time in Rome. Well, I must say that we had a quite good night (except for the noise from the streets outside of course) in our room and really were surprised by the very well sorted breakfast buffet the next morning. The guys at the reception were quite nice and friendly. The shower worked perfect. If they would invest a bit of money and time in remodeling the whole place this really would be a good offer to stay. But if not, I fear that within one or two years it would not be a pleasure in any way to stay there. The restaurants we had found around the hotel really were great and compared to the prices we had to pay nearer to the centre with all the tourist spots the dinners we had really were reasonably prized and very good. It is quite a way from the Termini Station to walk so I would recommend to use the bus which is passing right outside the hotel to bring you for just an Euro (buy it in advance at a Tabbacchi) to and from the Station to the hotel. The neighbourhood around is ok, nothing to fear about, even at dinner-times. We never felt afraid there. The pedestrian pavement of course is very tricky to walk at because the Romans do not care in any case about their dogs making a mess just anywhere you are stepping to. So, never walk there without watching where you are stepping to!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: hottogouk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bled has a nice atmosphere yet is let down by its location. Having said that it is only a 5 min walk to the nearest Metro station (although this was closed for maintenance while we were there) but the streets aren't the nicest. Our room was a reasonable size and kept well cleaned. The road at the front is quite noisy at night if you have a front facing room but is muted by the electronic shutters. The breakfast is a cold buffet with not a lot of choice but is adequate. In general you probably get what you pay for and the hotel in no way spoiled our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Charming”
Reviews.Author: blklthrjkt
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bled was very comfortable and clean. It is a bit off the beaten path, though not too far from several historical sites including the Coloseum, if you take a cab or don't mind the walk. The staff is friendly and the rooms are generous in size. Breakfast is above average.

Reviews.Title: “Wretched Hotel - Off the map”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough bad things about this hotel. It's literally off the Rome maps. Dirty, old, decrepit. You can see through the door jams. Grimy curtain sheers. Our first night, we were in the room next to the lobby, and we were awakened at 6 am with a dot matrix printer printing non-stop and of course the hustle and bustle of people coming and going. My bed sloped up in the middle, not down, like you would expect. (They must have flipped it over.) So I had to lay perfectly still to keep from rolling off either side. The bedspreads were dirty looking. They vacuumed the halls at very ungodly hours. The juice at the terrible breakfast was watered down. Seriously! The place was extremely overpriced and gave me the heebie jeebies.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the organised tours!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and two children (aged 9 and 11 at the time) stayed at the Hotel for four nights in 2003. We all had to pack into one room (2 adults in the double, one child in a single and one child in a portable bed) which was pretty standard as we travelled around Europe due to the ages of the children. We found Hotel Bled to be of average standard and we thought it was reasonably located (perhaps a 20 minute walk to the Colosseum/Forum?) which the children had no difficulty with. We walked everywhere apart from taking the Metro/bus to Tivoli. Our gripe was not with the Hotel, but with the tour that they recommended. 1 & 1/2 hour wait at their depot whilst they waited for THEIR buses to arrive. Rushed through all tours as they were running late. Lunch provided (in restaurant) was inedible. I hope that the Hotel has changed the tour company it deals with as this was the definite low point in our 5 week trip abroad.

Reviews.Title: “average hotle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in late February 2005 for 4 days. For the first night they put me in Hotel Daniela, the building next to Bled, without saying a reason. There the walls were so thin I could a person snoring in the next room! Most uncomfortable! Then the second day they changed me into Bled. The room was average, a bit worn. Across the crossroad where Bled is situated there were people sleeping on the street! Otherwise a nice area around. From the internet site of Bled I got the impression that there is a (free) safe deposit box in every room, but it was at the reception for 2,5 euros a day... The breakfast was not good, I think there were the same tomatoes and fruit on the table for 3 days, because the last morning they looked already ruined and the waitress just took some of the worst away!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in worse, stayed in better”
Reviews.Author: DonkeyVis
Reviews.Content: We were on the 3rd floor, tidy room and bathroom, clean but the whole place seemed a little dated to me. Breakfast was meats and pastries with juice and coffee. Helpful English speaking chap on reception. Location was about 25 mins walk from Colosseum, 5 mins from metro though the area seemed a little dubious after dark. We went the first week of September and it was seriously hot-32 degrees in the city. Air conditioning was most useful and there was a fridge and a tv with BBC. The picture of the virgin Mary above the bed ensured I never forgot which country I was in!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Get the room in the turret!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Bled in September 2004, and it was great. The room was on the top floor, in the turret, with an incredible view that overlooked the area on almost all sides. We could open the windows and sit on the sill and drink cocktails while watching the city below. The downside of the room is that the elevator didn’t go all the way to the top. We had to drag our luggage up a flight of steps, and when we opened the hotel room door, we were looking up another flight of steps. It was definitely worth the effort, but would be challenging for anyone with disabilities. The hotel is located in a real neighborhood, where you can actually hear people speaking Italian, which is rare in Rome. Not far from the hotel is a grocery store where you can get the most fabulous food and wine. As for the other reviews, I never saw bugs and never needed the air conditioner in September. Tip: If there are two or more of you traveling, forget the train to Termini from the airport. It will cost you as much if you just take a cab from the airport. A cab from Termini to Hotel Bled is about 25 Euro, in addition to the cost of the train.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: 25swan
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at this hotel July 1 -4, 2004. It was not in a central location as advertised but far from the things we wanted to see. We had to take the MetRo or a cab to get to anything worth seeing. There were homeless people sleeping around the corner. There was garbage all over the streets and no streetlights. One of our group was robbed on the Metro. The hotel itself was also very disappointing. The AC didn't work in some of the rooms. Other things needed fixing also. A couple of people complained about bugs in their rooms. The hotel has a separate building in the back. Don't ever stay there! It was really in need of repair and did not seem safe (no front desk). The young staff tried their best to help and accommodate us by moving some of us from the back building to the main hotel. The breakfast wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump. We had ants and bugs all over the room. We were there in late September and the temperatures were a little warm and the staff got an attitude when we asked them to turn the air on. Also none of the phone calls we tried to make went through yet we were charged for them anyways. I think for 150 Euros a night there has to be nicer places to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bled was ok, but several disappointments. Biggest problem was the misleading indication of air conditioning in the description of the hotel. Indeed, it has air, but during our visit - last week of June 2004 - the hotel only ran it from about 6pm to 11pm in the evening. No explanation why. Also, as noted in another review, if your room faces the street, it's loud. We used ear plugs to advantage. Room itself ok; bed ok; shower stall small. Breakfast fine.

Reviews.Title: “Broken A/C, Corner of Busy Intersection”
Reviews.Author: adventureashland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a sister of the Daniela Hotel around the corner which costs the same and is cute, A/C and quiet. We stayed here for one night and want to warn others against this hell. Broken A/C, on corner of busy intersection coming into to Rome, Lights hanging off wall, mattresses sagged terribly, etc.
